verses.verse: Woe <S%H480><s%> is me <S%H625><s%>! for I am as when they have gathered the summer fruits <S%H7019><s%>, as the grape gleanings <S%H5955><s%> of the vintage <S%H1210><s%>: there is no cluster <S%H811><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%>; my soul <S%H5315><s%> desireth <S%H183><s%> the first-ripe <S%H1063><s%> fig.

The godly <S%H2623><s%> man is perished <S%H6><s%> out of the earth <S%H776><s%>, and there is none upright <S%H3477><s%> among men <S%H120><s%>: they all lie in wait <S%H693><s%> for blood <S%H1818><s%>; they hunt <S%H6679><s%> every man <S%H376><s%> his brother <S%H251><s%> with a net <S%H2764><s%>.

Their hands <S%H3709><s%> are upon that which is evil <S%H7451><s%> to do it diligently <S%H3190><s%>; the prince <S%H8269><s%> asketh <S%H7592><s%>, and the judge <S%H8199><s%> is ready for a reward <S%H7966><s%>; and the great <S%H1419><s%> man <S%H1696><s%>, he uttereth the evil <S%H1942><s%> desire <S%H5315><s%> of his soul <S%H5686><s%>: thus they weave it together.

The best <S%H2896><s%> of them is as a brier <S%H2312><s%>; the most upright <S%H3477><s%> is worse than a thorn hedge <S%H4534><s%>: the day <S%H3117><s%> of thy watchmen <S%H6822><s%>, even thy visitation <S%H6486><s%>, is come <S%H935><s%>; now shall be their perplexity <S%H3998><s%>.

Trust <S%H539><s%> ye not in a neighbor <S%H7453><s%>; put ye not confidence <S%H982><s%> in a friend <S%H441><s%>; keep <S%H8104><s%> the doors <S%H6607><s%> of thy mouth <S%H6310><s%> from her that lieth <S%H7901><s%> in thy bosom <S%H2436><s%>.

For the son <S%H1121><s%> dishonoreth <S%H5034><s%> the father <S%H1><s%>, the daughter <S%H1323><s%> riseth up <S%H6965><s%> against her mother <S%H517><s%>, the daughter-in <S%H2545><s%>-law against her mother-in <S%H3618><s%>-law; a man <S%H376><s%>'s enemies <S%H341><s%> are the men <S%H582><s%> of his own house <S%H1004><s%>.
But as for me <S%H6822><s%>, I will look unto Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>; I will wait <S%H3176><s%> for the God <S%H430><s%> of my salvation <S%H3468><s%>: my God <S%H430><s%> will hear me <S%H8085><s%>.

Rejoice <S%H8055><s%> not against me <S%H341><s%>, O mine enemy: when I fall <S%H5307><s%>, I shall arise <S%H6965><s%>; when I sit <S%H3427><s%> in darkness <S%H2822><s%>, Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> will be a light unto me <S%H216><s%>.

I will bear <S%H5375><s%> the indignation <S%H2197><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, because I have sinned <S%H2398><s%> against him <S%H7378><s%>, until he plead my cause <S%H7379><s%>, and execute <S%H6213><s%> judgment <S%H4941><s%> for me <S%H3318><s%>: he will bring me forth to the light <S%H216><s%>, and I shall behold <S%H7200><s%> his righteousness <S%H6666><s%>.

Then mine enemy <S%H341><s%> shall see <S%H7200><s%> it <S%H955><s%>, and shame shall cover <S%H3680><s%> her who said <S%H559><s%> unto me <S%H3068><s%>, Where is Jehovah thy God <S%H430><s%>? Mine eyes <S%H5869><s%> shall see <S%H7200><s%> my desire upon her <S%H4823><s%>; now shall she be trodden down as the mire <S%H2916><s%> of the streets <S%H2351><s%>.
A day <S%H3117><s%> for building <S%H1129><s%> thy walls <S%H1447><s%>! in that day <S%H3117><s%> shall the decree <S%H2706><s%> be far removed <S%H7368><s%>.

In that day <S%H3117><s%> shall they come <S%H935><s%> unto thee from Assyria <S%H804><s%> and the cities <S%H5892><s%> of Egypt <S%H4693><s%>, and from Egypt <S%H4693><s%> even to the River <S%H5104><s%>, and from sea <S%H3220><s%> to sea <S%H3220><s%>, and from mountain <S%H2022><s%> to mountain <S%H2022><s%>.
Yet shall the land <S%H776><s%> be desolate <S%H8077><s%> because of them that dwell <S%H3427><s%> therein <S%H6529><s%>, for the fruit of their doings <S%H4611><s%>.

Feed <S%H7462><s%> thy people <S%H5971><s%> with thy rod <S%H7626><s%>, the flock <S%H6629><s%> of thy heritage <S%H5159><s%>, which dwell <S%H7931><s%> solitarily <S%H910><s%>, in the forest <S%H3293><s%> in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of Carmel <S%H3760><s%>: let them feed <S%H7462><s%> in Bashan <S%H1316><s%> and Gilead <S%H1568><s%>, as in the days <S%H3117><s%> of old <S%H5769><s%>.
As in the days <S%H3117><s%> of thy coming <S%H3318><s%> forth out of the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> will I show <S%H7200><s%> unto them marvellous things <S%H6381><s%>.

The nations <S%H1471><s%> shall see <S%H7200><s%> and be ashamed <S%H954><s%> of all their might <S%H1369><s%>; they shall lay <S%H7760><s%> their hand <S%H3027><s%> upon their mouth <S%H6310><s%>; their ears <S%H241><s%> shall be deaf <S%H2790><s%>.

They shall lick <S%H3897><s%> the dust <S%H6083><s%> like a serpent <S%H5175><s%>; like crawling things <S%H2119><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> they shall come trembling <S%H7264><s%> out of their close places <S%H4526><s%>; they shall come with fear <S%H3372><s%> unto Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> our God <S%H430><s%>, and shall be afraid because of thee <S%H3372><s%>.

Who is a God <S%H410><s%> like unto thee <S%H5375><s%>, that pardoneth iniquity <S%H5771><s%>, and passeth over <S%H5674><s%> the transgression <S%H6588><s%> of the remnant <S%H7611><s%> of his heritage <S%H5159><s%>? he retaineth <S%H2388><s%> not his anger <S%H639><s%> for ever <S%H5703><s%>, because he delighteth <S%H2654><s%> in lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%>.

He will again <S%H7725><s%> have compassion <S%H7355><s%> upon us <S%H3533><s%>; he will tread our iniquities <S%H5771><s%> under foot <S%H7993><s%>; and thou wilt cast all their sins <S%H2403><s%> into the depths <S%H4688><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%>.

Thou wilt perform <S%H5414><s%> the truth <S%H571><s%> to Jacob <S%H3290><s%>, and the lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%> to Abraham <S%H85><s%>, which thou hast sworn <S%H7650><s%> unto our fathers <S%H1><s%> from the days <S%H3117><s%> of old <S%H6924><s%>.
